contentrichtext.text: {{selfref|For the newspaper ''The Palestine Post'' (1932–1950), see [[The Jerusalem Post]].}} {{Infobox Government agency |agency_name = <small>Palestinian National Authority</small> <br> Palestine Post |type = Government Department |nativename = <big>'''البريد الفلسطيني'''</big> |nativename_a = |nativename_r = |logo = PalestinePost.JPG |logo_width = 250px |logo_caption = Palestine Post |jurisdiction = |headquarters = [[al-Bireh]], [[West Bank]] {{flagicon|Palestine}} |coordinates = |chief1_name = [[Fathi Shobak]] |chief1_position = [[Postmaster General|Director General]] |chief2_name = |chief2_position = |chief3_name = |chief3_position = |parent_agency = [[Ministry of Transport (Palestine)|Ministry of Transport]] |child1_agency = |child2_agency = |website = http://www.palpost.ps }} '''Palestine Post''' is the company responsible for [[mail|postal service]] in the parts of [[Palestinian territories]] controlled by the [[Palestinian National Authority]].<ref>{{cite web |title= Palestine Post |publisher= Palestine Post |accessdate=2010-02-07 |url=http://www.palpost.ps/ar/index.php?p=about_us}}</ref> ==See also== * [[Postage stamps and postal history of the Palestinian National Authority]] * [[Postage stamps and postal history of Palestine]] ==External links== * [http://www.palpost.ps Palestine Post official website (Arab only)] * [http://www.upu.int/news_centre/2009/en/2009-11-27_la_palestine_proche_d_un_echange_de_courrier_direct.html Universal Postal Union] ==References== {{Reflist}} {{Communications in the Palestinian territories}} {{Postal administrations of Asia}} [[Category:Communications in Palestine]] [[Category:Postal organisations]] {{Palestine-stub}}
